lead_paragraph: The thoroughbred great John Henry, a two-time horse of the year who earned more than $6.5 million before retiring to the Kentucky Horse Park, was euthanized yesterday, the park said. He was 32. A park spokeswoman said John Henry’s health had declined over the weekend. John Henry, a gelding, had lost considerable body mass and was in kidney failure, she said. John Henry, a Hall of Famer, was retired 22 years ago to the park, where officials were making plans for a public memorial service.
